projects.title: Real-Time Chat Application
projects.description: Build a full-stack real-time chat app with WebSockets, user authentication, message persistence, and typing indicators
projects.shortDescription: Real-time chat with WebSockets, auth, and message history
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality chat application using React, Node.js, Socket.io, and MongoDB. Implement real-time messaging with WebSockets, JWT authentication, message history with pagination, typing indicators, online status, and file uploads. This project demonstrates full-stack proficiency with real-time features highly valued in interviews.

implementationSteps.title: Design System Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Plan the full-stack architecture: React frontend, Node.js/Express backend, Socket.io for WebSockets, MongoDB for data persistence, Redis for session management. Design data models: User (username, email, password hash, avatar), Message (sender, recipient/room, content, timestamp, read status), Room (name, participants, type: direct/group). Plan real-time event flow: connect, disconnect, message, typing, read receipts.

implementationSteps.title: Build Authentication System
implementationSteps.description: Implement user registration and login with bcrypt password hashing. Create JWT-based authentication: access tokens (short-lived) and refresh tokens (long-lived). Build protected routes and middleware to verify tokens. Create user profile management. Store refresh tokens in httpOnly cookies for security. Implement logout and token revocation.

implementationSteps.title: Implement WebSocket Infrastructure
implementationSteps.description: Set up Socket.io server with authentication middleware to verify JWT before connection. Implement connection management: store socket IDs mapped to user IDs in Redis for quick lookups. Handle events: user:online, user:offline, message:send, message:receive, typing:start, typing:stop. Implement room-based communication for group chats and direct messages.

implementationSteps.title: Build Chat Frontend with React
implementationSteps.description: Create components: ChatList (conversations), ChatWindow (messages), MessageInput (send box), UserList (online users). Implement real-time message display with auto-scroll to latest. Use Socket.io client to emit and listen for events. Add typing indicators showing 'User is typing...'. Implement optimistic UI updates: show message immediately before server confirmation. Handle reconnection gracefully with message queue.

implementationSteps.title: Add Message Persistence & Features
implementationSteps.description: Store all messages in MongoDB with indexes on sender, recipient, and timestamp. Implement pagination for message history: load latest 50 messages, fetch more on scroll up. Add read receipts: track and display when messages are read. Implement search functionality to find messages by content. Add file upload support using Multer and AWS S3/Cloudinary for images and documents.

implementationSteps.title: Polish, Test & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Add message notifications using browser Notification API. Implement emoji picker and message reactions. Add user presence indicators (online, away, offline). Write integration tests for Socket.io events and API endpoints using Jest and Supertest. Implement rate limiting to prevent spam. Deploy frontend to Vercel, backend to Railway/Render with MongoDB Atlas and Redis Cloud.

projects.title: Multi-tenant SaaS Application
projects.description: Build a SaaS platform with multi-tenancy, role-based access control, subscription management, and admin dashboard
projects.shortDescription: SaaS app with multi-tenancy, RBAC, and billing
projects.fullDescription: Create a full-stack SaaS application demonstrating enterprise patterns: multi-tenant architecture (data isolation per organization), role-based access control (admin, manager, user roles), subscription management with Stripe, admin dashboard with analytics, and RESTful API design. This project showcases skills critical for B2B product companies.

implementationSteps.title: Design Multi-tenant Data Model
implementationSteps.description: Choose multi-tenancy strategy: shared database with tenant_id column (simplest, used here) vs separate databases per tenant. Design schema: Organization (tenant), User (with org_id and role), Subscription (plan, status, stripe_customer_id), Feature (plan-based feature flags). Add tenant_id to all domain tables (projects, tasks, etc.). Create middleware to automatically filter queries by current user's tenant_id for data isolation.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Authentication & RBAC
implementationSteps.description: Build JWT authentication with tenant and role information in token payload. Define roles: Super Admin (cross-tenant), Org Admin (manage org), Manager (manage team), User (read-only). Create permission system: use casl or custom middleware to check permissions (e.g., can('update', 'Project')). Implement invite system: org admins can invite users via email with role assignment.

implementationSteps.title: Build Subscription & Billing System
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Stripe: create customer on org signup, attach payment method, create subscription. Define plans: Free (limited features), Pro ($29/mo), Enterprise ($99/mo). Implement webhooks to handle: subscription.created, subscription.updated, payment.failed. Build upgrade/downgrade flow with prorated billing. Add usage-based metering (e.g., API calls, storage) and display in dashboard.

implementationSteps.title: Create Admin Dashboard Frontend
implementationSteps.description: Build React dashboard with charts using Recharts or Chart.js: user growth, revenue trends, active subscriptions. Create organization management: list orgs, view details, suspend/activate. Build user management table with filters by role, org, status. Add feature flag toggles per organization. Implement analytics: track page views, API usage, feature adoption with Mixpanel or custom events.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Core SaaS Features
implementationSteps.description: Build project/task management as the core feature (or choose your domain: CRM, project tracker, etc.). Implement team collaboration: assign tasks, comments, activity feed. Add file attachments with S3. Create API rate limiting based on subscription tier. Build notification system for important events. Add data export functionality (CSV/JSON) for user data portability.

implementationSteps.title: Security, Testing & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Implement security: SQL injection prevention (use parameterized queries), XSS protection, CSRF tokens, rate limiting. Add audit logging: track who did what and when (critical for compliance). Write tests: unit tests for RBAC logic, integration tests for payment flows. Set up CI/CD with GitHub Actions. Deploy with Docker: frontend (Vercel), backend (AWS ECS/Railway), database (RDS/PlanetScale).

projects.title: Scalable Microservices E-Commerce Platform
projects.description: Build a microservices-based e-commerce platform with API gateway, service discovery, message queues, and distributed tracing
projects.shortDescription: Microservices platform with API gateway and message queues
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a production-grade microservices architecture for an e-commerce system. Build separate services (User, Product, Order, Payment, Notification) communicating via REST APIs and message queues. Implement API gateway, service discovery, distributed tracing, centralized logging, and containerization with Docker. This advanced project demonstrates enterprise-level architecture skills.

implementationSteps.title: Design Microservices Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Identify bounded contexts and design services: (1) User Service (auth, profiles), (2) Product Service (catalog, inventory), (3) Order Service (cart, checkout, orders), (4) Payment Service (Stripe integration, transactions), (5) Notification Service (email, SMS). Define communication: synchronous (REST/gRPC for queries) and asynchronous (RabbitMQ/Kafka for events). Plan data strategy: each service has its own database (polyglot persistence).

implementationSteps.title: Build Individual Microservices
implementationSteps.description: Implement each service as a standalone Node.js/Express app with its own database. User Service: JWT auth, user CRUD. Product Service: product catalog, search, inventory management. Order Service: cart operations, order creation, order history. Payment Service: Stripe integration, payment processing, refunds. Each service exposes RESTful API and publishes domain events (UserCreated, OrderPlaced, PaymentCompleted).

implementationSteps.title: Implement API Gateway & Service Discovery
implementationSteps.description: Set up API Gateway using Express Gateway or Kong to route requests to appropriate services. Implement authentication at gateway level: verify JWT before forwarding to services. Add rate limiting, request logging, and CORS handling at gateway. Implement service discovery using Consul or hardcoded service registry for development. Add health check endpoints for each service.

implementationSteps.title: Add Message Queue & Event-Driven Flow
implementationSteps.description: Set up RabbitMQ with exchanges and queues for each event type. Implement saga pattern for distributed transactions: when order is placed, publish OrderCreated event → Payment Service processes payment → publishes PaymentCompleted → Order Service updates status → Notification Service sends confirmation email. Handle failure scenarios: if payment fails, publish PaymentFailed → Order Service cancels order.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Monitoring & Observability
implementationSteps.description: Add distributed tracing using Jaeger or Zipkin: instrument all HTTP requests and message queue operations with trace IDs. Centralize logging: use Winston with log aggregation (ELK stack or Loki). Add metrics collection with Prometheus: track request rates, latencies, error rates per service. Build Grafana dashboards showing service health, throughput, and error rates.

implementationSteps.title: Containerize & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Create Dockerfile for each service. Write docker-compose.yml for local development with all services, databases, RabbitMQ, and monitoring tools. For production, create Kubernetes manifests: Deployments for services, Services for networking, ConfigMaps for configuration, Secrets for credentials. Set up horizontal pod autoscaling based on CPU/memory. Deploy to managed Kubernetes (GKE/EKS) or use Docker Swarm for simpler setup.

implementationSteps.title: Build Admin Dashboard & Polish
implementationSteps.description: Create React admin dashboard: view all services status, monitor order flow, check payment transactions, view system metrics. Add circuit breaker pattern using libraries like opossum to handle service failures gracefully. Implement request retry logic with exponential backoff. Add comprehensive API documentation using Swagger for each service. Write integration tests for critical flows (order → payment → notification).
